{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3494167,"name":"Kush Ashar","username":"kushashar","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/bbce88/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-27T23:29:29.296Z","cooked":"

Our team’s teleop swerve drive works great and follows the translation and rotation inputs from the controller without any issues. However, when we tried using Pathplanner for autonomous mode, we noticed that the left-right direction of the path was flipped. The robot still completes the path, but both the path and the robot’s movement are mirrored left to right.

When we checked the odometry, we found that the left-right movement is inverted (when the robot drives right, the odometry shows it going left), while the forward-backward movement works as expected. We’re using MAXSwerve modules with Neos and are hoping someone might have run into a similar issue and found a solution.

Our code is linked here:

github.com

GitHub - AstraeaRobotics/2025-Reefscape

Contribute to AstraeaRobotics/2025-Reefscape development by creating an account on GitHub.

I’m far from a pro at swerve, this being our first year, but it’s possible you have your left and right locations, located from like 35-38 in your swerve drive subsystem, could be backwards? try flipping the left and right math and see if that fixes anything. You may need to multiply your controller movement by -1 for left right movement so it flips the correct way.

After looking at the MAXSwerve template, I noticed that our module locations are flipped. I’ll check if it works later today - thanks! Also, we tried to invert controller movement but odom/movement was still opposite.

first thing that comes to my mind is the module azimuth direction. if theyre clockwise positive i think it would give these symptoms, should be counter clockwise positive

No problem! Our odometry for left/right is still inversed however. Not really sure what the problem is anymore because I’ve tried tons of combinations of inversions. It may be that we aren’t feeding the correct angle to the odometry

I am going through something similar right now (where the left-right is flipped on PathPlanner) and I was wondering what steps you took to fix this? I tried moving around our module locations and flipping our encoders but nothing seems to do the trick to get everything properly working.

We have Neos, CANcoders, and a navx if that is relevant

Sorry for the late response. What ended up working for us was inverting our angle encoders in code and not just over rev client.
